definition: A term commonly employed to describe a large quantity or amount of something, often referring to a collective or bulk of objects or substances. It is frequently used in the context of physics and science to denote the measure of inertia possessed by a physical body. Additionally, it can refer to a crowd or multitude of people gathered together for a particular purpose.

examples.german: Die Masse des Objekts beträgt 1 Kilogramm.
examples.english: The mass of the object is 1 kilogram.

examples.german: Die Masse der Erde beträgt etwa 5,972 × 10^24 Kilogramm.
examples.english: The mass of the Earth is approximately 5.972 × 10^24 kilograms.

examples.german: Die Masse des Autos beeinflusst den Kraftstoffverbrauch.
examples.english: The mass of the car affects fuel consumption.

examples.german: Die Masse der Menschenmenge machte den Platz eng.
examples.english: The mass of the crowd made the space tight.

examples.german: Die Masse des Kuchens reicht für 10 Personen.
examples.english: The mass of the cake is enough for 10 people.
